posts.post_content:
Looking for a Grover Hartley T207 around $200 at most. All I have seen are the Broadleaf backs that are in the $300+ range. This is the last card to complete my Carl Molesworth Columbus Set.

Below is the challenge I have gone through since March.

PM or email, [url]shernan30@gmail.com[/url], what you have.

Thanks for looking, 

Steven

[STRIKE]Doug Baird - M101-4/5 Sporting News Blank Back[/STRIKE]
[STRIKE]Mandy Brooks - 1929 Zeenut[/STRIKE]
[STRIKE]Al Demaree - T222 Fatima Player Cards[/STRIKE]
[STRIKE]Duke Kenworthy - 1924 Walter Mails Card Game[/STRIKE]
[STRIKE]Ike Davis - 1928 Zeenut[/STRIKE]
[STRIKE]George McQuillan - E103 Williams Caramel[/STRIKE]
[STRIKE]Bill Regan - R316 Kashin Publications[/STRIKE]
[STRIKE]Dick Burrus - 1926 W461-5 Exhibits (Set 5) #18[/STRIKE]
[STRIKE]Hick (Forrest) Cady - T205 Gold Border[/STRIKE]
[STRIKE]Eddie Murphy - 1921 E-UNC Self Developing[/STRIKE]
[STRIKE]Emilio Palmero - 1923 Nacionales Cigarros[/STRIKE]
[STRIKE]Hank Schreiber - 1919 Cincinnati Reds Postcard[/STRIKE]
[STRIKE]Hugh High - 1922 Zeenuts[/STRIKE]
[STRIKE]John Sullivan - E123 Curtis Ireland Candy[/STRIKE]
[STRIKE]Patsy McGaffigan - 1921 Frederick Foto[/STRIKE]
[STRIKE]Reb Russell - WG4 Polo Grounds Game[/STRIKE]

Good luck with this. Grover Hartley managed the minor league team my uncle (1939) and grandpa (1940) played on. I was on a wild goose chase for this card for a LONG time. His cards are rare, and anything in decent condition fetches a couple hundred dollars at minimum. I got mine at the National this year, and it was the only one there I believe. There is a tiny bit of paper loss on the back, and obviously the crease down the middle. I paid around $140 for this, and will look to add a nicer condition one eventually. 

[IMG]https://pbs.twimg.com/media/CpDrssvVUAAr79N.jpg[/IMG]
